venueName: The Whale A Craft Beer Collective

pages.text:
[Page Title: West Asheville Location :: The Whale :: A Craft Beer Collective]

Skip to content 
West Asheville Location:
Menu Events Hours + Directions 
Asheville

has some fantastic local craft beers, we showcase something different. Our goal is to provide unique offerings that aren’t the same beers served at other bars around town. We handpick each selection of world-class craft beer from around the globe while paying special attention to quality and history. Often, we are fortunate to brew collaborative beers with local and regional breweries that are “Whale Exclusives”.

Well-behaved dogs are always welcome inside and on the patio. Food is available to be ordered from the , which is adjacent to the bar.
Haywood Common Kitche n 
We invite you to come in and enjoy a “White Whale” you have always wanted to try and have never gotten your hands on. Quench your thirst with your favorite ol’ reliable German pilsner. Pick a wild card and sip something you have never seen or heard of, but are glad you discovered it at
The Whale :: A Craft Beer Collective. W.AVL Menu W.AVL Events

[Page Title: Greenville Location :: The Whale :: A Craft Beer Collective]

Skip to content 
Greenville Location:
Menu Events Hours + Directions 
Greenville –

In the world of craft beer, a “whale” means a rare and special highly sought-after beer. Greenville is the home of the second location of . We are a craft beer bar that specializes in offering the best liquids from around the country and around the world. We started our first craft beer bar in Asheville, NC in 2017 and came down the mountain to Greenville, SC for our second location in 2019. Check us out at 1108 S. Main St in the Greene Building.
The Whale :: A Craft Beer Collective 
At The Whale GVL :: A Craft Beer Collective, you’ll find a vast selection of carefully selected liquids from some of the finest producers in the country and the world. We serve beverages that range from meticulously crafted classic and historical styles to cutting-edge creations that push the boundaries. We source beer from all over the world, and we are also excited to brew some “Whale Exclusives” with local and regional breweries.

No matter your preferences, there is something for you at The Whale GVL :: A Craft Beer Collective. Our knowledgeable bar staff is happy to assist you in making your selection or answer any questions you may have. We are not just a craft beer bar; we also maintain a carefully curated wine list and offer sake, mead, and non-alcoholic craft beverages.

Food Options

– Delivered Right To Your Table
The Goat Bar & Grill GVL Menu GVL Events

[Page Title: Haw Creek Location :: The Whale :: A Craft Beer Collective]

Skip to content 
Haw Creek Location:
Menu Events Hours + Directions 
The Outpost

is a craft beer bar and bottleshop located in East Asheville’s Haw Creek neighborhood. Rumor has it that the building The Outpost was once home to a stop on The Pony Express, hence its name. It has the charm and feels of an old hardware store and that old-world mercantile vibe is still alive and well.

The Outpost is a neighborhood beer bar where you can sip and shop. There are eight taps of draft beer and a more extensive package list than in our other locations. Pick out a brew and browse the shelves and coolers full of hard-to-find hype beer and breweries, wine, mead, cider, and seltzer.

If you’re an Asheville local and frequent our West Asheville location, The Outpost offers a different selection and experience while maintaining our sophisticated, fun, and unique approach to craft beer.

[Page Title: Charleston Location :: The Whale :: A Craft Beer Collective]

Skip to content 
Charleston Location:
Menu Events Hours + Directions 
Charleston –

The Whale CHS :: A Craft Beer Collective and tasting room inside the new Refinery Charleston complex on upper Meeting Street. It’s the Lowcountry outpost of an Asheville craft beer shop that features rare beers, wines, ciders, meads, seltzers, and sakes.

“While all three Whale locations share a core concept, we strive to give each space its own unique vibe and aesthetic,” Ross Says. “The Charleston space was inspired by the 1980s heyday of Miami’s Ocean Drive, and the design is an eccentric, playful mashup of art deco-meets-Elvis’ Jungle Room at Graceland.”

is an ode to the rare, hard-to-source beers. In addition to the , the duo also owns a shop in . And if you forget the name, a handcrafted neon whale tail made by Asheville artist Kevin Nonnenmacher of GIT LIT inside the shop will quickly remind you.
The Whale :: A Craft Beer Collective Asheville original Greenville 
At The Whale, you are able to order a beer, glass of wine, sake and more before grabbing a seat inside or out on The Whale’s rooftop patio, which features traditional German biergarten tables. A rotating lineup of food trucks is on-premise weekly.

Food Trucks

Check out our events calendar for our rotating food truck schedule!
